Special Offers and Discounts

Introduction: Why Special Offers and Discounts Matter

In today’s fast-paced business landscape, special offers and discounts have become essential tools for both buyers and sellers. For businesses, these promotions are effective strategies to boost visibility, increase sales, and retain customers. For customers, they provide opportunities to save money while gaining access to high-quality products or services.

Whether you’re setting up your first office, scaling a growing business, or simply looking to upgrade your equipment with cost-effective solutions, taking advantage of special offers and discounts can greatly improve your bottom line.

The Role of Special Offers in Business Solutions

1. Encouraging First-Time Purchases

Many customers are hesitant to make initial investments, especially when dealing with high-value equipment such as printers and copiers. A well-timed discount or introductory offer can be the deciding factor in converting a hesitant shopper into a loyal client.

For example, offering limited-time deals on printer rentals can reduce the barrier to entry for small businesses, especially those that are just starting out. It gives them the chance to access premium services without overstretching their initial capital.

2. Promoting Long-Term Customer Loyalty

Businesses that regularly provide value to customers are often rewarded with trust and repeat transactions. When customers know that a company offers seasonal sales or volume-based pricing, they are more likely to return and even refer others.

For example, offering discounts to customers who extend their rental contract or rent additional machines can build long-term relationships while reducing churn.

3. Clearing Inventory or Introducing New Products

Special promotions can help clear out old inventory and make room for new equipment. Alternatively, they can be used to launch new models or services by encouraging users to try them out at a lower cost.

This is particularly useful for companies offering portable printers, eco-friendly solutions, or home office packages—products that are evolving alongside modern workplace needs.
Check out how businesses are leveraging portable printers for home offices in creative ways.

Types of Special Offers and Discounts You Should Watch Out For

1. Bundle Deals

Bundling services or machines can help clients save more while getting everything they need in one package. For example, instead of renting a single printer, a client can opt for a copier + printer + support bundle at a reduced rate.

2. Volume-Based Discounts

Businesses that need to rent multiple units benefit from tiered pricing. The more they rent, the bigger the savings.

3. Seasonal Promotions

Back-to-school seasons, year-end holidays, and mid-year sales are great times to access special offers and discounts. These time-bound promotions are ideal for businesses looking to expand their fleet without overspending.

Explore benefits of renting printers for remote work during these promotional windows.

4. Loyalty and Referral Rewards

Some rental companies offer rewards for long-term customers or for those who refer new clients. This not only saves money but also builds a community around your business.

How Special Offers Benefit Different Business Types

For Startups

Startups often operate under tight budgets. Special offers and discounts allow them to access high-quality printers or copiers without committing to huge expenses upfront. Whether they need devices for printing contracts, marketing collaterals, or internal documents, rental deals provide a budget-friendly way to operate professionally.

Need to know what works best for startups? Check out this guide on setting up a home office printer.

For Schools and Educational Institutions

With printing needs that change throughout the academic year, schools can benefit greatly from seasonal rental offers. These may include discounts on short-term rentals during enrollment periods, midterms, or year-end report generation.

Some suppliers even offer exclusive education sector packages, which include servicing and consumables at a bundled rate.

For Large Enterprises

Big businesses can take advantage of volume-based pricing and multi-location discounts. For example, a corporate office needing 20 units for nationwide branches can negotiate significant savings with a rental provider.

Marga Enterprises: Making Discounts Work for You

At Marga Enterprises, we understand the needs of every business—big or small. Our goal is to deliver premium equipment and services at the best possible value. That’s why we regularly roll out special offers and discounts that match the current needs of our clients.

Examples of Our Discount Programs:

  • New Client Offers – Get a 10% discount on your first rental agreement.

  • Referral Rewards – Refer a friend or partner and earn service credits.

  • Loyalty Discounts – Long-term clients receive preferential pricing and additional support perks.

  • Seasonal Campaigns – Access limited-time deals during key times of the year.

Want to see how clients have benefitted from our services? View our case studies on printer rentals for remote work for real-world success stories.

Tips for Making the Most Out of Special Offers

1. Sign Up for Newsletters

Stay ahead by subscribing to rental company newsletters. You’ll be the first to know when a new offer launches.

2. Ask for Customized Quotes

Not all deals are advertised online. Contacting a sales representative directly can sometimes get you a tailor-made deal, especially for large or ongoing rentals.

3. Compare Bundles vs. A La Carte

Sometimes bundles offer more value than selecting individual components. Consider what’s included—service, delivery, consumables—and calculate the cost-benefit.

4. Review the Terms

Always check the fine print. Are there hidden fees? Are consumables included? Is support 24/7? The best offer is not always the lowest price—it’s the best value.

When Not to Use a Discount

While special offers and discounts are appealing, they may not always be the right fit.

  • If the offer limits essential services (like on-site support), it might not be ideal.

  • If the discounted equipment is outdated or cannot meet your printing needs, it could cost you more in productivity losses.

  • If the duration of the discount is too short for your project timeline, the hassle may outweigh the savings.

Always weigh cost-saving benefits against long-term reliability and support.

Trends in Promo-Based Equipment Rental

With the increase in remote work and hybrid environments, more people are renting printers for home offices. This shift has led to seasonal and remote-friendly packages that include:

  • Delivery and setup

  • Remote troubleshooting

  • Print monitoring services

  • Preloaded cartridges

As this trend continues, expect more rental companies to create promotional campaigns tailored for flexible working needs. Don’t miss these opportunities—especially if you’re considering new setups or upgrades.

What to Ask Your Provider Before Committing

Before accepting a special offer, ask:

  1. What’s included in the promotion?

  2. How long is the offer valid?

  3. Are there hidden fees like delivery or cartridge costs?

  4. What kind of technical support is provided?

  5. Can the plan be upgraded if my needs grow?

Transparent answers to these questions will ensure that your discount turns into a real business advantage.

Conclusion: Don’t Just Rent—Save Smartly

Choosing to rent a printer or copier is already a smart business move—but choosing to rent during a promo period or with a loyalty-based discount is even smarter. Special offers and discounts can make a significant impact on your operational costs and overall efficiency.

So whether you’re a startup looking to reduce expenses, a school preparing for the next term, or an enterprise scaling operations across regions, keep an eye out for value-added deals. With the right partner like Marga Enterprises, you’ll find the perfect combination of performance, price, and support.
